definition: to visit one's parents
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring

sentences.english: We can call it a visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把这称作一次省亲。

sentences.english: Visiting parents poetry before the Tang Dynasty expresses home complex of personal homesickness.
sentences.chinese: 唐前省亲诗仅表达了个人思归的家园情结。

sentences.english: A special cake , called the mothering cake, was often brought along to provide a festive touch.
sentences.chinese: 他们带回的特别的省亲蛋糕增添了节日的气氛。

sentences.english: Visting parents is an etiquette to pay filial homage to parents.
sentences.chinese: 省亲是归家探望父母的礼俗。

sentences.english: According to the regulations concerned, he has only a couple of weeks (more than ten days) every four years to visit his relatives.
sentences.chinese: 期间按规定每四年才能有十多天的时间回老家省亲。

sentences.english: With every homecoming, there is also a farewell.
sentences.chinese: 每次省亲回家但终究是要说声再见。

sentences.english: Every year I used to arrange the schedule to go home while spend vacation by the way.
sentences.chinese: 以往我每年必须找一个假期，回家省亲，顺便度假。

definition: to go home to visit one's family
to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
to return to the capital
(literary) (of a married woman) to visit one's parents
to observe mourning for one's parents
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to go on an inspection tour
to make a trip home
to go into mourning for one's parents
first return of bride to her parental home
to call to pay one's respect/to call on
return of the emperor
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to enter the capital/to go to Beijing
on imperial orders
